adjective.description: Of a container: having a small mouth or opening.
Of an animal: having a narrow mouth. Chiefly in "narrow-mouthed toad"noun any of various toads of the family Microhylidae, especially of the American genus Gastrophryne and the Asian genus Microhyla.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas Hill (b. c1528). From narrow + mouthed.
